UI.CanvasScaler.ScaleMode: Determines how UI elements in the Canvas are scaled.
UI.CanvasScaler.ScaleMode.ScaleWithScree:
Using the Scale With Screen Size mode, positions and sizes can be specified according to the pixels of a specified reference resolution.
If the current screen resolution is larger then the reference resolution, the Canvas will keep having only the resolution of the reference resolution, but will scale up in order to fit the screen. If the current screen resolution is smaller than the reference resolution, the Canvas will similarly be scaled down to fit.
UI.CanvasScaler.ScreenMatchMode.Expand: Expand the canvas area either horizontally or vertically, so the size of the canvas will never be smaller than the reference.
UI.CanvasScaler.ScreenMatchMode: Scale the canvas area with the width as reference, the height as reference, or something in between.
UI.CanvasScaler.ScreenMatchMode.MatchWid: Scale the canvas area with the width as reference, the height as reference, or something in between.
UI.CanvasScaler.ScreenMatchMode.Shrink: Crop the canvas area either horizontally or vertically, so the size of the canvas will never be larger than the reference.
UI.CanvasScaler.SetReferencePixelsPerUni: Sets the referencePixelsPerUnit on the Canvas.

UI.CanvasScaler.Unit.Centimeters:
Use centimeters.
A centimeter is 1/100 of a meter.
UI.CanvasScaler.Unit: Settings used to specify a physical unit.
UI.CanvasScaler.Unit.Millimeters:
Use millimeters.
A millimeter is 1/10 of a centimeter, and 1/1000 of a meter.
UI.CanvasScaler.Unit.Picas:
Use picas.
One pica is 1/6 of an inch.
UI.CanvasScaler.Unit.Points:
Use points.
One point is 1/12 of a pica, and 1/72 of an inch.

Undo.undoRedoPerformed: Callback that is triggered after an undo or redo was executed.
Undo.willFlushUndoRecord: Invoked before the Undo system performs a flush.
Undo.AddComponent: Adds a component to the game object and registers an undo operation for this action.
Undo.ClearAll: Removes all undo and redo operations from  respectively the undo and redo stacks.
Undo.ClearUndo: Removes all Undo operation for the identifier object registered using Undo.RegisterCompleteObjectUndo from the undo stack.
Undo.CollapseUndoOperations: Collapses all undo operation up to group index together into one step.
Undo.DestroyObjectImmediate: Destroys the object and records an undo operation so that it can be recreated.
Undo.FlushUndoRecordObjects: Ensure objects recorded using RecordObject or ::ref:RecordObjects are registered as an undoable action. In most cases there is no reason to invoke FlushUndoRecordObjects since it's automatically done right after mouse-up and certain other events that conventionally marks the end of an action.
Undo.GetCurrentGroup: Unity automatically groups undo operations by the current group index.
Undo.GetCurrentGroupName: Get the name that will be shown in the UI for the current undo group.
Undo: Lets you register undo operations on specific objects you are about to perform changes on.
Undo.IncrementCurrentGroup: Unity automatically groups undo operations by the current group index.
Undo.MoveGameObjectToScene:
Move a GameObject from its current scene to a new scene.
It is required that the GameObject is at the root of its current scene.
Undo.RecordObject: Records any changes done on the object after the RecordObject function.
Undo.RecordObjects: Records multiple undoable objects in a single call. This is the same as calling Undo.RecordObject multiple times.
Undo.RegisterCompleteObjectUndo: Stores a copy of the object states on the undo stack.
Undo.RegisterCreatedObjectUndo: Register an undo operations for a newly created object.
Undo.RegisterFullObjectHierarchyUndo: Copy the states of a hierarchy of objects onto the undo stack.
Undo.RevertAllDownToGroup: Performs all undo operations up to the group index without storing a redo operation in the process.
Undo.RevertAllInCurrentGroup: Performs the last undo operation but does not record a redo operation.
Undo.SetCurrentGroupName: Set the name of the current undo group.
Undo.SetTransformParent: Sets the parent of transform to the new parent and records an undo operation.
UnityAPICompatibilityVersionAttribute.ct: Initializes a new instance of UnityAPICompatibilityVersionAttribute.
UnityAPICompatibilityVersionAttribute: Declares an assembly to be compatible (API wise) with a specific Unity API. Used by internal tools to avoid processing the assembly in order to decide whether assemblies may be using old Unity API.
UnwrapParam.hardAngle: This angle (in degrees) or greater between triangles will cause seam to be created.
UnwrapParam.packMargin: How much uv-islands will be padded.
UnwrapParam.SetDefaults: Will set default values for params.
Unwrapping.GeneratePerTriangleUV: Will generate per-triangle uv (3 UVs for each triangle) with default settings.
Unwrapping.GenerateSecondaryUVSet: Will auto generate uv2 with default settings for provided mesh, and fill them in.
Unwrapping: This class holds everything you may need in regard to uv-unwrapping.

UserAuthorization.WebCam: Request permission to use any video input sources attached to the computer.

VersionControl.Asset.fullName: Gets the full name of the asset including extension.
VersionControl.Asset.isFolder: Returns true if the asset is a folder.

VersionControl.Asset.isMeta: Returns true if the instance of the Asset class actually refers to a .meta file.

https://docs.unity3d.com/2017.4/Documentation/ScriptReference/VersionControl.Asset-name.html
VersionControl.Asset.path: Gets the path of the asset.
VersionControl.Asset.readOnly: Returns true is the asset is read only.

VersionControl.Asset: This class containes information about the version control state of an asset.
VersionControl.Asset.IsOneOfStates: Returns true if the version control state of the assets is one of the input states.
VersionControl.Asset.IsState: Returns true if the version control state of the asset exactly matches the input state.
VersionControl.Asset.States.AddedLocal: The was locally added to version control.
VersionControl.Asset.States.AddedRemote: Remotely this asset was added to version control.
VersionControl.Asset.States.CheckedOutLo: The asset has been checked out on the local machine.
VersionControl.Asset.States.CheckedOutRe: The asset has been checked out on a remote machine.
VersionControl.Asset.States.Conflicted: There is a conflict with the asset that needs to be resolved.
VersionControl.Asset.States.DeletedLocal: The asset has been deleted locally.
VersionControl.Asset.States.DeletedRemot: The asset has been deleted on a remote machine.
VersionControl.Asset.States: Describes the various version control states an asset can have.
VersionControl.Asset.States.Local: The asset is not under version control.
VersionControl.Asset.States.LockedLocal: The asset is locked by the local machine.
VersionControl.Asset.States.LockedRemote: The asset is locked by a remote machine.
VersionControl.Asset.States.MetaFile: This instance of the class actaully refers to a .meta file.
VersionControl.Asset.States.Missing: The asset exists in version control but is missing on the local machine.
VersionControl.Asset.States.None: The version control state is unknown.
VersionControl.Asset.States.OutOfSync: A newer version of the asset is available on the version control server.
VersionControl.Asset.States.Synced: The asset is up to date.
VersionControl.Asset.States.Updating: The state of the asset is currently being queried from the version control server.
VersionControl.AssetList.Filter: Based on the current list and the states a new list is returned which only contains the assets with the requested states.
VersionControl.AssetList.FilterChildren: Create an optimised list of assets by removing children of folders in the same list.
VersionControl.AssetList.FilterCount: Count the list of assets by given a set of states.
VersionControl.AssetList: A list of version control information about assets.
VersionControl.ChangeSet.defaultID: The ID of  the default changeset.
VersionControl.ChangeSet.id: Version control specific ID of a changeset.
VersionControl.ChangeSet: Wrapper around a changeset description and ID.
VersionControl.CheckoutMode: What to checkout when starting the Checkout task through the version control Provider.
VersionControl.CompletionAction: Different actions a version control task can do upon completion.
VersionControl.CompletionAction.OnChange: Update the content of a pending changeset with the result of the task upon completion.
Update the pending changesets with the result of the task upon completion.
VersionControl.CompletionAction.OnChecko: Show or update the checkout failure window.
VersionControl.CompletionAction.OnGotLat: Refreshes the incoming and pensing changes window upon task completion.
VersionControl.CompletionAction.OnIncomi: Update incoming changes window with the result of the task upon completion.
VersionControl.CompletionAction.OnSubmit: Refresh the submit window with the result of the task upon completion.
VersionControl.CompletionAction.UpdatePe: Update the list of pending changes when a task completes.
VersionControl.ConfigField.isPassword: This is true if the configuration field is a password field.
VersionControl.ConfigField.isRequired: This is true if the configuration field is required for the version control plugin to function correctly.
VersionControl.ConfigField.label: Label that is displayed next to the configuration field in the editor.
https://docs.unity3d.com/2017.4/Documentation/ScriptReference/VersionControl.ConfigField-label.html
VersionControl.ConfigField.name: Name of the configuration field.
https://docs.unity3d.com/2017.4/Documentation/ScriptReference/VersionControl.ConfigField-name.html
VersionControl.MergeMethod: Which method to use when merging.

VersionControl.Message.Show: Write the message to the console.

VersionControl.OnlineState.Offline: Connection to the version control server could not be established.
VersionControl.OnlineState.Online: Connection to the version control server has been established.
VersionControl.OnlineState.Updating: The version control provider is currently trying to connect to the version control server.

VersionControl.Provider.enabled: Returns true if the version control provider is enabled and a valid Unity Pro License was found.
VersionControl.Provider.isActive: Returns true if a version control plugin has been selected and configured correctly.
VersionControl.Provider.offlineReason: Returns the reason for the version control provider being offline (if it is offline).
VersionControl.Provider.onlineState: Returns the OnlineState of the version control provider.
VersionControl.Provider.requiresNetwork: This is true if a network connection is required by the currently selected version control plugin to perform any action.

VersionControl.Provider.AddIsValid: Given a list of assets this function returns true if Add is a valid task to perform.
VersionControl.Provider.ChangeSetDescrip: Given a changeset only containing the changeset ID, this will start a task for quering the description of the changeset.
VersionControl.Provider.ChangeSetMove: Move an asset or list of assets from their current changeset to a new changeset.
VersionControl.Provider.ChangeSets: Get a list of pending changesets owned by the current user.
VersionControl.Provider.ChangeSetStatus: Retrieves the list of assets belonging to a changeset.

VersionControl.Provider.ClearCache: This will invalidate the cached state information for all assets.
VersionControl.Provider.Delete: This will statt a task for deleting an asset or assets both from disk and from version control system.
VersionControl.Provider.DeleteChangeSets: Starts a task that will attempt to delete the given changeset.
Test if deleting a changeset is a valid task to perform.
VersionControl.Provider.DiffHead: Starts a task for showing a diff of the given assest versus their head revision.
VersionControl.Provider.DiffIsValid: Return true is starting a Diff task is a valid operation.
VersionControl.Provider.GetActiveConfigF: Returns the configuration fields for the currently active version control plugin.
VersionControl.Provider.GetActivePlugin: Gets the currently user selected verson control plugin.
VersionControl.Provider.GetAssetByGUID: Returns version control information about an asset.
VersionControl.Provider.GetAssetByPath: Returns version control information about an asset.
VersionControl.Provider.GetAssetListFrom: Return version control information about the currently selected assets.
VersionControl.Provider.GetLatest: Start a task for getting the latest version of an asset from the version control server.
VersionControl.Provider.GetLatestIsValid: Returns true if getting the latest version of an asset is a valid operation.
VersionControl.Provider: This class provides acces to the version control API.
VersionControl.Provider.Incoming: Start a task for quering the version control server for incoming changes.
VersionControl.Provider.IncomingChangeSe: Given an incoming changeset this will start a task to query the version control server for which assets are part of the changeset.
VersionControl.Provider.IsOpenForEdit: Returns true if an asset can be edited.
VersionControl.Provider.Lock: Attempt to lock an asset for exclusive editing.
VersionControl.Provider.LockIsValid: Return true if the task can be executed.
VersionControl.Provider.Merge: This method will initiate a merge task handle merging of the conflicting assets.

VersionControl.RevertMode.Normal: Use the version control regular revert approach.

VerticalWrapMode.Truncate: Text will be clipped when reaching the vertical boundary.
Video.Video3DLayout: Types of 3D content layout within a video.
Video.Video3DLayout.No3D: Video does not have any 3D content.
Video.Video3DLayout.OverUnder3D: Video contains 3D content where the left eye occupies the upper half and right eye occupies the lower half of video frames.
Video.Video3DLayout.SideBySide3D: Video contains 3D content where the left eye occupies the left half and right eye occupies the right half of video frames.
Video.VideoAspectRatio.FitHorizontally: Resize proportionally so that width fits the target area, cropping or adding black bars above and below if needed.
Video.VideoAspectRatio.FitInside: Resize proportionally so that content fits the target area, adding black bars if needed.
Video.VideoAspectRatio.FitOutside: Resize proportionally so that content fits the target area, cropping if needed.
Video.VideoAspectRatio.FitVertically: Resize proportionally so that height fits the target area, cropping or adding black bars on each side if needed.
Video.VideoAspectRatio: Methods used to fit a video in the target area.
Video.VideoAspectRatio.NoScaling: Preserve the pixel size without adjusting for target area.
Video.VideoAspectRatio.Stretch: Resize non-proportionally to fit the target area.
Video.VideoAudioOutputMode.AudioSource: Send the embedded audio into a specified AudioSource.
Video.VideoAudioOutputMode.Direct: Send the embedded audio direct to the platform's audio hardware.
Video.VideoAudioOutputMode: Places where the audio embedded in a video can be sent.
Video.VideoClip.audioTrackCount: Number of audio tracks in the clip.

Video.VideoClip.frameRate: The frame rate of the clip in frames/second. (Read Only).

Video.VideoClip.GetAudioLanguage: Get the audio track language.  Can be unknown.
Video.VideoClip.GetAudioSampleRate: Get the audio track sampling rate in Hertz.
Video.VideoPlayer.aspectRatio: Defines how the video content will be stretched to fill the target area.
Video.VideoPlayer.audioOutputMode: Destination for the audio embedded in the video.
Video.VideoPlayer.audioTrackCount: Number of audio tracks found in the data source currently configured.
Video.VideoPlayer.canSetDirectAudioVolum: Whether direct-output volume controls are supported for the current platform and video format. (Read Only)
Video.VideoPlayer.canSetPlaybackSpeed: Whether the playback speed can be changed. (Read Only)
Video.VideoPlayer.canSetSkipOnDrop: Determines whether the VideoPlayer skips frames to catch up with current time. (Read Only)
Video.VideoPlayer.canSetTime: Whether current time can be changed using the time or timeFrames property. (Read Only)
Video.VideoPlayer.canSetTimeSource: Whether the time source followed by the VideoPlayer can be changed. (Read Only)

Video.VideoPlayer.clockResyncOccurred: Invoked when the VideoPlayer's clock is synced back to its VideoTimeReference.
Video.VideoPlayer.controlledAudioTrackCo:
Number of audio tracks that this VideoPlayer will take control of. The other ones will be silenced. A maximum of 64 tracks are allowed.
The actual number of audio tracks cannot be known in advance when playing URLs, which is why this value is independent of the VideoPlayer.audioTrackCount property.
Video.VideoPlayer.controlledAudioTrackMa: Maximum number of audio tracks that can be controlled.
Video.VideoPlayer.errorReceived: Errors such as HTTP connection problems are reported through this callback.
Video.VideoPlayer.externalReferenceTime: Reference time of the external clock the VideoPlayer uses to correct its drift.
Video.VideoPlayer.frame: The frame index currently being displayed by the VideoPlayer.
Video.VideoPlayer.frameCount: Number of frames in the current video content.
Video.VideoPlayer.frameDropped: [NOT YET IMPLEMENTED] Invoked when the video decoder does not produce a frame as per the time source during playback.
Video.VideoPlayer.frameRate: The frame rate of the clip or URL in frames/second. (Read Only).
Video.VideoPlayer.frameReady: Invoked when a new frame is ready.
Video.VideoPlayer.isLooping: Determines whether the VideoPlayer restarts from the beginning when it reaches the end of the clip.
Video.VideoPlayer.isPlaying: Whether content is being played. (Read Only)
Video.VideoPlayer.isPrepared: Whether the VideoPlayer has successfully prepared the content to be played. (Read Only)
Video.VideoPlayer.loopPointReached: Invoked when the VideoPlayer reaches the end of the content to play.
Video.VideoPlayer.playbackSpeed: Factor by which the basic playback rate will be multiplied.
Video.VideoPlayer.playOnAwake: Whether the content will start playing back as soon as the component awakes.
Video.VideoPlayer.prepareCompleted: Invoked when the VideoPlayer preparation is complete.
Video.VideoPlayer.renderMode: Where the video content will be drawn.
Video.VideoPlayer.seekCompleted: Invoke after a seek operation completes.
Video.VideoPlayer.skipOnDrop: Whether the VideoPlayer is allowed to skip frames to catch up with current time.
Video.VideoPlayer.source: The source that the VideoPlayer uses for playback.
Video.VideoPlayer.started: Invoked immediately after Play is called.
Video.VideoPlayer.targetCamera: Camera component to draw to when VideoPlayer.renderMode is set to either VideoRenderMode.CameraFarPlane or VideoRenderMode.CameraNearPlane.
Video.VideoPlayer.targetCamera3DLayout: Type of 3D content contained in the source video media.
Video.VideoPlayer.targetCameraAlpha: Overall transparency level of the target camera plane video.
Video.VideoPlayer.targetMaterialProperty: Material texture property which is targeted when VideoPlayer.renderMode is set to Video.VideoTarget.MaterialOverride.
Video.VideoPlayer.targetMaterialRenderer: Renderer which is targeted when VideoPlayer.renderMode is set to Video.VideoTarget.MaterialOverride
Video.VideoPlayer.targetTexture: RenderTexture to draw to when VideoPlayer.renderMode is set to Video.VideoTarget.RenderTexture.
Video.VideoPlayer.texture: Internal texture in which video content is placed.
Video.VideoPlayer.time: The VideoPlayer current time in seconds.

VideoClipImporter.transcodeSkipped: Returns true if transcoding was skipped during import, false otherwise. (Read Only)When VideoImporterTargetSettings.enableTranscoding is set to true, the resulting transcoding operation done at import time may be quite long, up to many hours depending on source resolution and content duration. An option to skip this process is offered in the asset import progress bar. When skipped, the transcoding instead provides a non-transcoded verision of the asset. However, the importer settings stay intact so this property can be inspected to detect the incoherence with the generated artifact.Re-importing without stopping the transcode process, or with transcode turned off, causes this property to become false.

VRTextureUsage: This enum describes how the RenderTexture is used as a VR eye texture. Instead of using the values of this enum manually, use the value returned by eyeTextureDesc or other VR functions returning a RenderTextureDescriptor.
VRTextureUsage.None: The RenderTexture is not a VR eye texture. No special rendering behavior will occur.
VRTextureUsage.OneEye: This texture corresponds to a single eye on a stereoscopic display.
VRTextureUsage.TwoEyes: This texture corresponds to two eyes on a stereoscopic display. This will be taken into account when using Graphics.Blit and other rendering functions.
WaitForEndOfFrame: Waits until the end of the frame after all cameras and GUI is rendered, just before displaying the frame on screen.

WaitForSeconds.ctor: Creates a yield instruction to wait for a given number of seconds using scaled time.
WaitForSeconds: Suspends the coroutine execution for the given amount of seconds using scaled time.
WaitForSecondsRealtime.ctor: Creates a yield instruction to wait for a given number of seconds using unscaled time.
WaitForSecondsRealtime: Suspends the coroutine execution for the given amount of seconds using unscaled time.
WaitUntil.ctor: Initializes a yield instruction with a given delegate to be evaluated.
WaitUntil: Suspends the coroutine execution until the supplied delegate evaluates to true.
WaitWhile.ctor: Initializes a yield instruction with a given delegate to be evaluated.
WaitWhile: Suspends the coroutine execution until the supplied delegate evaluates to false.

Windows.Speech.GrammarRecognizer.ctor: Creates a grammar recognizer using specified file path and minimum confidence.
Windows.Speech.GrammarRecognizer.Grammar: Returns the grammar file path which was supplied when the grammar recognizer was created.
Windows.Speech.GrammarRecognizer:
The GrammarRecognizer is a complement to the KeywordRecognizer. In many cases developers will find the KeywordRecognizer fills all their development needs. However, in some cases, more complex grammars will be better expressed in the form of an xml file on disk.
The GrammarRecognizer uses Extensible Markup Language (XML) elements and attributes, as specified in the World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) Speech Recognition Grammar Specification (SRGS) Version 1.0. These XML elements and attributes represent the rule structures that define the words or phrases (commands) recognized by speech recognition engines.

WindZone.mode: Defines the type of wind zone to be used (Spherical or Directional).
WindZone.radius: Radius of the Spherical Wind Zone (only active if the WindZoneMode is set to Spherical).

WindZone: Wind Zones add realism to the trees you create by making them wave their branches and leaves as if blown by the wind.

WrapMode.Loop: When time reaches the end of the animation clip, time will continue at the beginning.
WrapMode.Once: When time reaches the end of the animation clip, the clip will automatically stop playing and time will be reset to beginning of the clip.
WrapMode.PingPong: When time reaches the end of the animation clip, time will ping pong back between beginning and end.

WWW.error: Returns an error message if there was an error during the download (Read Only).
WWW.isDone: Is the download already finished? (Read Only)
WWW.movie: Returns a MovieTexture generated from the downloaded data (Read Only).
WWW.oggVorbis: Load an Ogg Vorbis file into the audio clip.
WWW.progress: How far has the download progressed (Read Only).
WWW.responseHeaders: Dictionary of headers returned by the request.
WWW.text: Returns the contents of the fetched web page as a string (Read Only).
WWW.texture: Returns a Texture2D generated from the downloaded data (Read Only).
WWW.textureNonReadable: Returns a non-readable Texture2D generated from the downloaded data (Read Only).
WWW.uploadProgress: How far has the upload progressed (Read Only).
WWW.url: The URL of this WWW request (Read Only).
WWW.Dispose: Disposes of an existing WWW object.
WWW.EscapeURL: Escapes characters in a string to ensure they are URL-friendly.
WWW.GetAudioClip: Returns an AudioClip generated from the downloaded data (Read Only).
WWW.GetAudioClipCompressed: Returns an AudioClip generated from the downloaded data that is compressed in memory (Read Only).
WWW.GetMovieTexture: Returns a MovieTexture generated from the downloaded data (Read Only).
WWW.LoadFromCacheOrDownload: Loads an AssetBundle with the specified version number from the cache. If the AssetBundle is not currently cached, it will automatically be downloaded and stored in the cache for future retrieval from local storage.
WWW.LoadImageIntoTexture: Replaces the contents of an existing Texture2D with an image from the downloaded data.
WWW.UnEscapeURL: Converts URL-friendly escape sequences back to normal text.
WWWForm.data: (Read Only) The raw data to pass as the POST request body when sending the form.
WWWForm.headers: (Read Only) Returns the correct request headers for posting the form using the WWW class.
WWWForm.AddBinaryData: Add binary data to the form.
WWWForm.AddField: Add a simple field to the form.
WWWForm: Helper class to generate form data to post to web servers using the UnityWebRequest or WWW classes.
XboxBuildSubtarget.Debug: Debug player (for building with source code).
XR.ARBackgroundRenderer.backgroundMateri: The Material used for AR rendering.
XR.ARBackgroundRenderer.backgroundRender: Called when any of the public properties of this class have been changed.
XR.ARBackgroundRenderer.backgroundTextur: An optional Texture used for AR rendering. If this property is not set then the texture set in ARBackgroundRenderer.backgroundMaterial as "_MainTex" is used.
XR.ARBackgroundRenderer.camera: An optional Camera whose background rendering will be overridden by this class. If this property is not set then the main Camera in the scene is used.
XR.ARBackgroundRenderer.mode: When set to ARRenderMode.StandardBackground (default) the camera is not overridden to display the background image. Setting this property to ARRenderMode.MaterialAsBackground will render the texture specified by ARBackgroundRenderer.backgroundMaterial and or ARBackgroundRenderer.backgroundTexture as the background.
XR.ARBackgroundRenderer.DisableARBackgro: Disables AR background rendering. This method is called internally but can be overridden by users who wish to subclass ARBackgroundRenderer to customize handling of AR background rendering.
XR.ARBackgroundRenderer: Class used to override a camera's default background rendering path to instead render a given Texture and/or Material. This will typically be used with images from the color camera for rendering the AR background on mobile devices.
XR.ARRenderMode: Enumeration describing the AR rendering mode used with ARBackgroundRenderer.
XR.ARRenderMode.MaterialAsBackground: The material associated with ARBackgroundRenderer is being rendered as the background.
XR.ARRenderMode.StandardBackground: The standard background is rendered. (Skybox, Solid Color, etc.)
XR.Daydream.SupportedHeadTracking.SixDoF: Devices that support 6 Degrees of Freedom head tracking.
XR.Daydream.SupportedHeadTracking.ThreeD: Devices that support 3 Degrees of Freedom head tracking.
XR.InputTracking.disablePositionalTracki: Disables positional tracking in XR. This takes effect the next time the head pose is sampled.  If set to true the camera only tracks headset rotation state.
XR.InputTracking.nodeAdded: Called when a tracked node is added to the underlying XR system.
XR.InputTracking.nodeRemoved: Called when a tracked node is removed from the underlying XR system.
XR.InputTracking.trackingAcquired: Called when a tracked node begins reporting tracking information.
XR.InputTracking.trackingLost: Called when a tracked node stops reporting tracking information.
XR.InputTracking.GetLocalPosition: Gets the position of a specific node.
XR.InputTracking.GetLocalRotation: Gets the rotation of a specific node.
XR.InputTracking.GetNodeName: Accepts the unique identifier for a tracked node and returns a friendly name for it.
XR.InputTracking.GetNodeStates: Describes all presently connected XR nodes and provides available tracking state.
XR.InputTracking: A collection of methods and properties for interacting with the XR tracking system.
XR.InputTracking.Recenter: Center tracking to the current position and orientation of the HMD.
XR.TrackingSpaceType: Represents the size of physical space available for XR.
XR.TrackingSpaceType.RoomScale: Represents a space large enough for free movement.
XR.TrackingSpaceType.Stationary: Represents a small space where movement may be constrained or positional tracking is unavailable.
XR.UserPresenceState: Represents the current user presence state detected by the device.
XR.UserPresenceState.NotPresent: The device does not detect that the user is present.
XR.UserPresenceState.Present: The device detects that the user is present.
XR.UserPresenceState.Unknown: The device is currently in a state where it cannot determine user presence.
XR.UserPresenceState.Unsupported: The device does not support detecting user presence.
XR.WSA.HolographicSettings.ActivateLaten: Option to allow developers to achieve higher framerate at the cost of high latency.  By default this option is off.
XR.WSA.HolographicSettings.HolographicRe: The image should not be stabilized for the user's head motion, instead remaining fixed in the display. This is generally discouraged, as it is only comfortable for users when used sparingly, such as when the only visible content is a small cursor.
Represents the kind of reprojection an app is requesting to stabilize its holographic rendering relative to the user's head motion.

The image should be stabilized only for changes to the user's head orientation, ignoring positional changes. This is best for body-locked content that should tag along with the user as they walk around, such as 360-degree video.
The image should be stabilized for changes to both the user's head position and orientation. This is best for world-locked content that should remain physically stationary as the user walks around.
XR.WSA.HolographicSettings: The Holographic Settings contain functions which effect the performance and presentation of Holograms on Windows Holographic platforms.
XR.WSA.HolographicSettings.IsContentProt: Whether the app is displaying protected content.
XR.WSA.HolographicSettings.IsDisplayOpaq: This method returns whether or not the display associated with the main camera reports as opaque.
XR.WSA.HolographicSettings.IsLatentFrame: Returns true if Holographic rendering is currently running with Latent Frame Presentation.  Default value is false.
XR.WSA.HolographicSettings.ReprojectionM: The kind of reprojection the app is requesting to stabilize its holographic rendering relative to the user's head motion.
XR.WSA.HolographicSettings.SetFocusPoint: Sets a point in 3d space that is the focal point of the scene for the user for this frame. This helps improve the visual fidelity of content around this point. This must be set every frame.
XR.WSA.Input.GestureErrorEventArgs.hresu: The HRESULT code from the platform.

XR.WSA.Input.GestureRecognizer.CancelGes: Cancels any pending gesture events.  Additionally this will call StopCapturingGestures.

Fires when recognition of gestures is done, either due to completion of a gesture or cancellation.

Fires when recognition of gestures begins.

XR.WSA.Input.GestureRecognizer.StopCaptu: Call to stop receiving gesture events on this recognizer.
XR.WSA.Input.GestureRecognizer.Tapped: Fires when Microsoft's gesture-recognition system recognizes that a user has done a tap gesture and after the system voice command "Select" has been processed. For controllers, this event fires when the primary button is released after it was pressed.

Enable support for the navigation gesture, in the vertical axis using rails (guides).

XR.WSA.Input.InteractionSourcePositionAc: A position accuracy of Approximate reports that you may not want to fully trust the positions reported, as the position is inferred or synthesized in some way, such as the controller leaving the sensors' field of view and forcing the API to rely on the device's IMU instead of visual tracking.
A position accuracy of High reports that you can fully trust the position, as the interaction source is within the sensors' visual field of view.
Denotes the accuracy of tracking on the interaction source.
A position accuracy of None reports that there is no position accuracy, as the interaction source unlocatable.
XR.WSA.Input.InteractionSourcePressedEve: Denotes the type of button that was just pressed.
The current state of the reported interaction source that just had one of its buttons enter the pressed state.
Contains fields that are relevent when an interaction source enters the pressed state for one of its buttons.
These buttons are generally found on the side of the controller. Some hardware has more than one grasp button.
XR.WSA.Input.InteractionSourcePressType: The type of button or controller feature pressed, if any.
This button is marked with three horizontal lines, same as you would fine on an Xbox One controller.
Depending on the InteractionSourceType of the interaction source, this could be a number of equivalent things: main button on a blicker, air-tap on a hand, and the trigger on a motion controller.
Similar to the touchpad, moving the thumbstick won't count as pressing it - a press will occur when pressing down on the thumbstick enough.
A touchpad only counts as pressed when it's held down enough - otherwise, it's just touched, and will give a reading of the position through InteractionSourceState.touchpadPosition.
XR.WSA.Input.InteractionSourceProperties: The position and velocity of the hand, expressed in the specified coordinate system - this has been deprecated. Use InteractionSourcePose instead.
The direction you should suggest that the user move their hand if it is nearing the edge of the detection area.
Gets the risk that detection of the hand will be lost as a value from 0.0 to 1.0.

XR.WSA.Input.InteractionSourceState.sele: Depending on the InteractionSourceType of the interaction source, this returning true could represent a number of equivalent things: main button on a clicker, air-tap on a hand, and the trigger on a motion controller. For hands, a select-press represents the user's index finger in the down position. For motion controllers, a select-press represents the controller's index-finger trigger (or primary face button, if no trigger) being fully pressed. Note that a voice command of "Select" causes an instant press and release, so you cannot poll for a voice press using this property - instead, you must use GestureRecognizer and subscribe to the Tapped event, or subscribe to the InteractionSourcePressed event from InteractionManager.
Normalized amount ([0, 1]) representing how much select is pressed.

XR.WSA.SpatialMappingBase.bakePhysics: This property specifies whether or not collision data will be generated when computing the surface mesh's triangulation. (Read Only)
XR.WSA.SpatialMappingBase.freezeUpdates: Specifies if the component should listen and respond to spatial surface changes.
XR.WSA.SpatialMappingBase.halfBoxExtents: The half extents of the bounding box from its center.
XR.WSA.SpatialMappingBase.lodType: The level of detail that should be used when generating surface meshes.
XR.WSA.SpatialMappingBase.numUpdatesBefo: The number of frames to keep a surface mesh alive for before destroying it after the system has determined that its real world counterpart has been removed.
XR.WSA.SpatialMappingBase.secondsBetween: The time in seconds between system queries for changes in physical space.
XR.WSA.SpatialMappingBase.sphereRadius: The radius of the bounding sphere volume.
XR.WSA.SpatialMappingBase.surfaceParent: The GameObject that should be the parent of all the component's surface mesh game objects.
XR.WSA.SpatialMappingBase.volumeType: The surface observer volume to use when querying the system for changes in physical space.
XR.WSA.SpatialMappingBase: The base class for all spatial mapping components.
XR.WSA.SpatialMappingBase.LODType.High: Generates surface meshes with the maximum amount of triangles.
XR.WSA.SpatialMappingBase.LODType: The number of triangles per cubic meter or level of detail that should be used when creating a surface mesh.
XR.WSA.SpatialMappingBase.LODType.Low: Generates surface meshes with as few triangles as possible.
XR.WSA.SpatialMappingBase.LODType.Medium: Generates a medium quality surface mesh.
XR.WSA.SpatialMappingBase.OnBeginSurface: This method is called when the system notifies the spatial mapping component that a surface has been removed.
XR.WSA.SpatialMappingBase.OnSurfaceDataR: This method will be called by the system when the surface data has been generated.
XR.WSA.SpatialMappingBase.VolumeType.Axi: An axis aligned bounding box volume.
XR.WSA.SpatialMappingBase.VolumeType: The surface observer volume type to use when querying the system for changes in physical space.
XR.WSA.SpatialMappingCollider.enableColl: Enables/Disables MeshCollider components on all spatial surfaces associated with the SpatialMappingCollider component instance.
XR.WSA.SpatialMappingCollider.layer: Sets the layer on all spatial surfaces associated with the SpatialMappingCollider component instance.
XR.WSA.SpatialMappingCollider.material: Sets the PhysicMaterial on all spatial surfaces associated with the SpatialMappingCollider component instance.
XR.WSA.SpatialMappingCollider: Creates and manages the GameObjects that represent spatial surfaces.  A MeshFilter and MeshCollider will automatically be added to these game objects so that holograms can interact with physical surfaces.
XR.WSA.SpatialMappingRenderer.occlusionM: A Material applied to all surface meshes to enable occlusion of holograms by real world objects.
XR.WSA.SpatialMappingRenderer.renderStat: Controls which Material will be used when rendering a surface mesh.
XR.WSA.SpatialMappingRenderer.visualMate: A material that can be used to visualize the spatial surface.
XR.WSA.SpatialMappingRenderer: Creates and manages the GameObjects that represent spatial surfaces.  A MeshFilter, MeshRenderer, and material will automatically be added to these GameObjects so that the spatial surface can be visualized.
XR.WSA.SpatialMappingRenderer.RenderStat: Specifies how to render the spatial surfaces associated with the SpatialMappingRenderer component instance.
Disables all MeshRenderer components associated with the SpatialMappingRenderer component instance.
Indicates that the Occlusion material should be used to render the surfaces.
Indicates that the Visualization material should be used to render the surfaces.
XR.WSA.SurfaceChange: Enumeration of the different types of SurfaceChange events.
XR.WSA.SurfaceData.bakeCollider: Set this field to true when requesting data to bake collider data.  This field will be set to true when receiving baked data if it was requested.  Setting this field to true requires that a valid outputCollider is also specified.
XR.WSA.SurfaceData.ctor: Constructor for conveniently filling out a SurfaceData struct.
XR.WSA.SurfaceData.id: This is the ID for the surface to be baked or the surface that was baked and being returned to the user.
XR.WSA.SurfaceData.outputAnchor: This WorldAnchor is used to lock the surface into place relative to real world objects.  It will be filled in when calling RequestMeshAsync to generate data for a surface and returned with the SurfaceDataReadyDelegate.
XR.WSA.SurfaceData.outputCollider: This MeshCollider will receive the baked physics mesh prepared by the system when requesting baked surface data through RequestMeshAsync.  The MeshCollider is returned in the SurfaceDataReadyDelegate for those users requiring advanced workflows.
XR.WSA.SurfaceData.outputMesh: This MeshFilter will receive the baked mesh prepared by the system when requesting baked surface data.  The MeshFilter is returned in the SurfaceDataReadyDelegate for those users requiring advanced workflows.
XR.WSA.SurfaceData.trianglesPerCubicMete: This value controls the basic resolution of baked mesh data and is returned with the SurfaceDataReadyDelegate.  The device will deliver up to this number of triangles per cubic meter.
XR.WSA.SurfaceData: SurfaceData is a container struct used for requesting baked spatial mapping data and receiving that data once baked.
XR.WSA.SurfaceId.handle: The actual integer ID referring to a single surface.
XR.WSA.SurfaceId: SurfaceId is a structure wrapping the unique ID used to denote Surfaces.  SurfaceIds are provided through the onSurfaceChanged callback in Update and returned after a RequestMeshAsync call has completed.  SurfaceIds are guaranteed to be unique though Surfaces are sometimes replaced with a new Surface in the same location with a different ID.
XR.WSA.SurfaceObserver.Dispose: Call Dispose when the SurfaceObserver is no longer needed.  This will ensure that the object is cleaned up appropriately but will not affect any Meshes, components, or objects returned by RequestMeshAsync.
XR.WSA.SurfaceObserver: SurfaceObserver is the main API portal for spatial mapping functionality in Unity.
XR.WSA.SurfaceObserver.RequestMeshAsync: Call RequestMeshAsync to start the process of baking mesh data for the specified surface.  This data may take several frames to create.  Baked data will be delivered through the specified SurfaceDataReadyDelegate.  This method will throw ArgumentNullExcpetion and ArgumentException if parameters specified in the dataRequest are invalid.
XR.WSA.SurfaceObserver.SetVolumeAsAxisAl: This method sets the observation volume as an axis aligned box at the requested location.  Successive calls can be used to reshape the observation volume and/or to move it in the scene as needed.  Extents are the distance from the center of the box to its edges along each axis.
XR.WSA.SurfaceObserver.SetVolumeAsFrustu: This method sets the observation volume as a frustum at the requested location.  Successive calls can be used to reshape the observation volume and/or to move it in the scene as needed.
XR.WSA.SurfaceObserver.SetVolumeAsOrient: This method sets the observation volume as an oriented box at the requested location.  Successive calls can be used to reshape the observation volume and/or to move it in the scene as needed.  Extents are the distance from the center of the box to its edges along each axis.
XR.WSA.SurfaceObserver.SetVolumeAsSphere: This method sets the observation volume as a sphere at the requested location.  Successive calls can be used to reshape the observation volume and/or to move it in the scene as needed.
XR.WSA.SurfaceObserver.SurfaceChangedDel: The SurfaceChanged delegate handles SurfaceChanged events as generated by calling Update on a SurfaceObserver.  Applications can use the bounds, changeType, and updateTime to selectively generate mesh data for the set of known surfaces.
XR.WSA.SurfaceObserver.SurfaceDataReadyD: The SurfaceDataReadyDelegate handles events generated when the engine has completed generating a mesh.  Mesh generation is requested through GetMeshAsync and may take many frames to complete.
XR.WSA.SurfaceObserver.Update: Update generates SurfaceChanged events which are propagated through the specified callback.  If no callback is specified, the system will throw an ArgumentNullException.  Generated callbacks are synchronous with this call.  Scenes containing multiple SurfaceObservers should consider using different callbacks so that events can be properly routed.
XR.WSA.WebCam.CameraParameters.cameraRes: A valid height resolution for use with the web camera.
A valid width resolution for use with the web camera.
XR.WSA.WebCam.CameraParameters.frameRate: The framerate at which to capture video.  This is only for use with VideoCapture.
XR.WSA.WebCam.CameraParameters.pixelForm: The pixel format used to capture and record your image data.
XR.WSA.WebCam.CameraParameters: When calling PhotoCapture.StartPhotoModeAsync, you must pass in a CameraParameters object that contains the various settings that the web camera will use.
XR.WSA.WebCam.CapturePixelFormat.BGRA32: 8 bits per channel (blue, green, red, and alpha).
XR.WSA.WebCam.CapturePixelFormat: The encoded image or video pixel format to use for PhotoCapture and VideoCapture.
XR.WSA.WebCam.CapturePixelFormat.NV12: 8-bit Y plane followed by an interleaved U/V plane with 2x2 subsampling.
XR.WSA.WebCam.PhotoCapture.CaptureResult: Specifies that an error has occurred.
Contains the result of the capture request.
Specifies that the desired operation was successful.
Specifies that an unknown error occurred.
XR.WSA.WebCam.PhotoCapture.CreateAsync: Asynchronously creates an instance of a PhotoCapture object that can be used to capture photos.
XR.WSA.WebCam.PhotoCapture.Dispose: Dispose must be called to shutdown the PhotoCapture instance.
XR.WSA.WebCam.PhotoCapture.GetUnsafePoin: Provides a COM pointer to the native IVideoDeviceController.
XR.WSA.WebCam.PhotoCapture: Captures a photo from the web camera and stores it in memory or on disk.
XR.WSA.WebCam.PhotoCapture.OnCapturedToD: Called when a photo has been saved to the file system.
XR.WSA.WebCam.PhotoCapture.OnCapturedToM: Called when a photo has been captured to memory.
XR.WSA.WebCam.PhotoCapture.OnCaptureReso: Called when a PhotoCapture resource has been created.
XR.WSA.WebCam.PhotoCapture.OnPhotoModeSt: Called when photo mode has been started.
Called when photo mode has been stopped.
XR.WSA.WebCam.PhotoCapture.PhotoCaptureR: A generic result that indicates whether or not the PhotoCapture operation succeeded.
Indicates whether or not the operation was successful.
A data container that contains the result information of a photo capture operation.
XR.WSA.WebCam.PhotoCapture.SupportedReso: A list of all the supported device resolutions for taking pictures.
XR.WSA.WebCam.PhotoCapture.TakePhotoAsyn: Asynchronously captures a photo from the web camera and saves it to disk.
XR.WSA.WebCam.PhotoCaptureFrame.dataLeng: The length of the raw IMFMediaBuffer which contains the image captured.
XR.WSA.WebCam.PhotoCaptureFrame.hasLocat: Specifies whether or not spatial data was captured.
XR.WSA.WebCam.PhotoCaptureFrame.pixelFor: The raw image data pixel format.
XR.WSA.WebCam.PhotoCaptureFrame.CopyRawI: Will copy the raw IMFMediaBuffer image data into a byte list.
XR.WSA.WebCam.PhotoCaptureFrame.Dispose: Disposes the PhotoCaptureFrame and any resources it uses.
XR.WSA.WebCam.PhotoCaptureFrame.GetUnsaf: Provides a COM pointer to the native IMFMediaBuffer that contains the image data.
XR.WSA.WebCam.PhotoCaptureFrame: Contains information captured from the web camera.
XR.WSA.WebCam.PhotoCaptureFrame.TryGetCa: This method will return the camera to world matrix at the time the photo was captured if location data if available.
XR.WSA.WebCam.PhotoCaptureFrame.TryGetPr: This method will return the projection matrix at the time the photo was captured if location data if available.
XR.WSA.WebCam.PhotoCaptureFrame.UploadIm: This method will copy the captured image data into a user supplied texture for use in Unity.
XR.WSA.WebCam.VideoCapture.AudioState.Ap: Include both the application audio as well as the mic audio in the video recording.
Only include the application audio in the video recording.
XR.WSA.WebCam.VideoCapture.AudioState: Specifies what audio sources should be recorded while recording the video.
XR.WSA.WebCam.VideoCapture.AudioState.Mi: Only include the mic audio in the video recording.
XR.WSA.WebCam.VideoCapture.AudioState.No: Do not include any audio in the video recording.
XR.WSA.WebCam.VideoCapture.CaptureResult: Specifies that an error has occurred.
Contains the result of the capture request.
Specifies that the desired operation was successful.
Specifies that an unknown error occurred.
XR.WSA.WebCam.VideoCapture.CreateAsync: Asynchronously creates an instance of a VideoCapture object that can be used to record videos from the web camera to disk.
XR.WSA.WebCam.VideoCapture.Dispose: Dispose must be called to shutdown the PhotoCapture instance.
XR.WSA.WebCam.VideoCapture.GetSupportedF: Returns the supported frame rates at which a video can be recorded given a resolution.
XR.WSA.WebCam.VideoCapture.GetUnsafePoin: Provides a COM pointer to the native IVideoDeviceController.
XR.WSA.WebCam.VideoCapture: Records a video from the web camera directly to disk.
XR.WSA.WebCam.VideoCapture.IsRecording: Indicates whether or not the VideoCapture instance is currently recording video.
XR.WSA.WebCam.VideoCapture.OnStartedReco: Called when the web camera begins recording the video.
XR.WSA.WebCam.VideoCapture.OnStoppedReco: Called when the video recording has been saved to the file system.
XR.WSA.WebCam.VideoCapture.OnVideoCaptur: Called when a VideoCapture resource has been created.
XR.WSA.WebCam.VideoCapture.OnVideoModeSt: Called when video mode has been started.
Called when video mode has been stopped.
XR.WSA.WebCam.VideoCapture.StartRecordin: Asynchronously records a video from the web camera to the file system.
XR.WSA.WebCam.VideoCapture.StopRecording: Asynchronously stops recording a video from the web camera to the file system.
XR.WSA.WebCam.VideoCapture.SupportedReso: A list of all the supported device resolutions for recording videos.
XR.WSA.WebCam.VideoCapture.VideoCaptureR: A generic result that indicates whether or not the VideoCapture operation succeeded.
Indicates whether or not the operation was successful.
A data container that contains the result information of a video recording operation.
XR.WSA.WebCam.WebCam: Contains general information about the current state of the web camera.
XR.WSA.WebCam.WebCam.Mode: Specifies what mode the Web Camera is currently in.
XR.WSA.WebCam.WebCamMode: Describes the active mode of the Web Camera resource.
XR.WSA.WorldAnchor.isLocated: Returns true if this WorldAnchor is located (read only).  A return of false typically indicates a loss of tracking.
XR.WSA.WorldAnchor.GetNativeSpatialAncho:
Retrieve a native pointer to the Windows.Perception.Spatial.SpatialAnchor COM object.
This function calls IUnknown::AddRef on the pointer before returning it. The pointer must be released by calling IUnknown::Release.
XR.WSA.WorldAnchor: The WorldAnchor component allows a GameObject's position to be locked in physical space.
XR.WSA.WorldAnchor.OnTrackingChanged: OnTrackingChanged notifies listeners when this object's tracking state changes.
XR.WSA.WorldAnchor.OnTrackingChangedDele: Event that is fired when this object's tracking state changes.
XR.WSA.WorldAnchor.SetNativeSpatialAncho: Assigns the Windows.Perception.Spatial.SpatialAnchor COM pointer maintained by this WorldAnchor.
XR.WSA.WorldManager.state: The current state of the world tracking systems.
XR.WSA.WorldManager.GetNativeISpatialCoo: Return the native pointer to Windows::Perception::Spatial::ISpatialCoordinateSystem which was retrieved from an Windows::Perception::Spatial::ISpatialStationaryFrameOfReference object underlying the Unity World Origin.
XR.WSA.WorldManager: This class represents the state of the real world tracking system.
XR.WSA.WorldManager.OnPositionalLocatorS: Event fired when the world tracking systems state has changed.
Callback on when the world tracking systems state has changed.
XR.XRDevice.family: The name of the family of the loaded XR device.
XR.XRDevice.isPresent: Successfully detected a XR device in working order.
XR.XRDevice.model: Specific model of loaded XR device.
XR.XRDevice.refreshRate: Refresh rate of the display in Hertz.
XR.XRDevice.userPresence: Indicates whether the user is present and interacting with the device.
XR.XRDevice.DisableAutoXRCameraTracking: Sets whether the camera passed in the first parameter is controlled implicitly by the XR Device
XR.XRDevice.GetNativePtr: This method returns an IntPtr representing the native pointer to the XR device if one is available, otherwise the value will be IntPtr.Zero.
XR.XRDevice.GetTrackingSpaceType: Returns the device's current TrackingSpaceType. This value determines how the camera is positioned relative to its starting position. For more, see the section "Understanding the camera" in VROverview.
XR.XRDevice: Contains all functionality related to a XR device.
XR.XRDevice.SetTrackingSpaceType: Sets the device's current TrackingSpaceType. Returns true on success. Returns false if the given TrackingSpaceType is not supported or the device fails to switch.
XR.XRNode.CenterEye: Node representing a point between the left and right eyes.
XR.XRNode.GameController: Represents a tracked game Controller not associated with a specific hand.
XR.XRNode.HardwareTracker: Represents a physical device that provides tracking data for objects to which it is attached.
XR.XRNode.Head: Node representing the user's head.
https://docs.unity3d.com/2017.4/Documentation/ScriptReference/XR.XRNode.Head.html
XR.XRNode: Enumeration of tracked XR nodes which can be updated by XR input.
XR.XRNode.TrackingReference: Represents a stationary physical device that can be used as a point of reference in the tracked area.
XR.XRNodeState.acceleration: Sets the vector representing the current acceleration of the tracked node.
XR.XRNodeState.angularAcceleration: Sets the vector representing the current angular acceleration of the tracked node.
XR.XRNodeState.angularVelocity: Sets the vector representing the current angular velocity of the tracked node.
XR.XRNodeState.nodeType: The type of the tracked node as specified in XRNode.
XR.XRNodeState.position: Sets the vector representing the current position of the tracked node.
XR.XRNodeState.rotation: Sets the quaternion representing the current rotation of the tracked node.
XR.XRNodeState.tracked:
Set to true if the node is presently being tracked by the underlying XR system,
and false if the node is not presently being tracked by the underlying XR system.
XR.XRNodeState.uniqueID: The unique identifier of the tracked node.
XR.XRNodeState.velocity: Sets the vector representing the current velocity of the tracked node.
XR.XRNodeState: Describes the state of a node tracked by a XR system. .
XR.XRNodeState.TryGetAcceleration: Attempt to retrieve a vector representing the current acceleration of the tracked node.
XR.XRNodeState.TryGetAngularAcceleration: Attempt to retrieve a Vector3 representing the current angular acceleration of the tracked node.
XR.XRNodeState.TryGetAngularVelocity: Attempt to retrieve a Vector3 representing the current angular velocity of the tracked node.
XR.XRNodeState.TryGetPosition: Attempt to retrieve a vector representing the current position of the tracked node.
XR.XRNodeState.TryGetRotation: Attempt to retrieve a quaternion representing the current rotation of the tracked node.
XR.XRNodeState.TryGetVelocity: Attempt to retrieve a vector representing the current velocity of the tracked node.
XR.XRSettings.enabled: Globally enables or disables XR for the application.
XR.XRSettings.eyeTextureDesc: Fetch the eye texture RenderTextureDescriptor from the active stereo device.
XR.XRSettings.eyeTextureHeight: The current height of an eye texture for the loaded device.
XR.XRSettings.eyeTextureResolutionScale: Controls the actual size of eye textures as a multiplier of the device's default resolution.
XR.XRSettings.eyeTextureWidth: The current width of an eye texture for the loaded device.
XR.XRSettings.isDeviceActive: Read-only value that can be used to determine if the XR device is active.
XR.XRSettings.loadedDeviceName: Type of XR device that is currently loaded.
XR.XRSettings.occlusionMaskScale: A scale applied to the standard occulsion mask for each platform.
XR.XRSettings.renderScale: This field has been deprecated. Use XRSettings.eyeTextureResolutionScale instead.
XR.XRSettings.renderViewportScale: Controls how much of the allocated eye texture should be used for rendering.
XR.XRSettings.showDeviceView: Mirror what is shown on the device to the main display, if possible.
XR.XRSettings.supportedDevices: Returns a list of supported XR devices that were included at build time.
XR.XRSettings.useOcclusionMesh: Specifies whether or not the occlusion mesh should be used when rendering. Enabled by default.
XR.XRSettings.LoadDeviceByName: Loads the requested device at the beginning of the next frame.
XR.XRStats.gpuTimeLastFrame: Total GPU time utilized last frame as measured by the XR subsystem.
XR.XRStats: Timing and other statistics from the XR subsystem.
XR.XRStats.TryGetDroppedFrameCount: Retrieves the number of dropped frames reported by the XR SDK.
XR.XRStats.TryGetFramePresentCount: Retrieves the number of times the current frame has been drawn to the device as reported by the XR SDK.
XR.XRStats.TryGetGPUTimeLastFrame: Retrieves the time spent by the GPU last frame, in seconds, as reported by the XR SDK.
YieldInstruction: Base class for all yield instructions.
